Html tags list \t\t HTML TAG: \n\t\tExplanation:\n \t\t\t Specifies an html document. The HTML element (or HTML root element) represents the root of an HTML document. All other elements must be descendants of this element. Since the element is the first in a document other than comments, it is called the root element. Although this tag can be implied, or not required, with HTML, it is required to be opened and closed in XHTML. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nxmlns + global attributes\n Syntax:\n\n basic tag.. \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n ...\n ...\n \t\t BASE TAG: \n\t\tExplanation:\n \t\t\t Specifies URL which non-absolute URLs are relative to. The HTML element specifies the base URL to use for all relative URLs contained within a document. There can be only one element in a document. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nhref | target (_self | _blank | _parent | _top) + global attributes\n Syntax:\n\n title \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n smartglossa\n \n \t\t HEAD TAG: \n\t\tExplanation:\n \t\t\t First element of the HTML document. Collection of metadata for the Document. The HTML element provides general information (metadata) about the document, including its title and links to its scripts and style sheets. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\n global attributes\n Syntax:\n\n ... \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n ... \n \n \n \n \t\t LINK TAG: \n\t\tExplanation:\n \t\t\t Other resources related to the document. The HTML element specifies relationships between the current document and an external resource. Possible uses for this element include defining a relational framework for navigation. This Element is most used to link to style sheets. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nhref | rel | media | hre†ang | type | sizes | crossorigin | integrity + global attributes\n Syntax:\n\n \n\n \n Example:\n\n \n \n ...\n \n \n \n \n \t\t META TAG: \n\t\t Explanation:\n The tag provides structured metadata about the document. The element may only appear in the head section of a document, although it may appear any number of times. \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\ncharset | content | http-equiv | name + global attributes \n Syntax:\n\n \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \t\t STYLE TAG: \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\t Embed style information in the documents. The HTML \n \n Example:\n\n \t\t TITLE TAG: \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tHTML tag define a document title that display on browser header. <title> tag define on head section in document. <title> does not support Dynamic attributes or Event attributes.\n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n <title> This is the page title \n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n \t\t ADDRESS TAG: \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tThe HTML
element supplies contact information for its nearest
or ancestor; in the latter case, it applies to the whole document.\n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n
Area Of Address..
\n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n
989,smartglossa
\n \n \t\t ARTICLE TAG: \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tSection of the page content, such as a blog or forum post. The HTML
element represents a self-contained composition in a document, page, application, or site, which is intended to be independently distributable or reusable (e.g., in syndication). This could be a forum post, a magazine or newspaper article, a blog entry, an object, or any other independent item of content. Each
should be identiတed, typically by including a heading (

-

element) as a child of the
element.\n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n
Area Of Address..
\n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n

hai smartglossa.

Posted on May 17 by smartglossa.

\n \n \t\t BODY TAG: \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tMain content of the document. The HTML Element represents the content of an HTML document. There can be only one element in a document.\n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nonafterprint | onbeforeprint | onbeforeunload | onblur | onerror | onfocus | onhashchange | onlanguagechange | onload | onmessage | ono†ine | ononline | onpopstate | onredo | onresize | onstorage | onundo | onunload + global attributes \n Syntax:\n\n use tags ../body>\n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n ... \n \t\t ASIDE TAG: \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\t such as a advertising or quotes.\n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n
...
\n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n
hai smartglossa
\n \n \t\t FOOTER TAG: \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\tFooter of the current section. The HTML
element represents a footer for its nearest sectioning content or sectioning root element. A footer typically contains information about the author of the section, copyright data or links to related documents \n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n
Some copyright documents here
\n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n
Some copyright documents here
\n H1 TO H6 tag: \t\t H1 TO H6 TAG: \n\t\t Explanation:\n \t\t Heading for the current section. Heading elements implement six levels of document headings,

is the most important and

is the least.\n Attributes (modifiers):\n\nglobal attributes \n Syntax:\n\n

..

....
..
\n \n Example:\n\n \n \n \n \n

Heading level 1

\n
